name: 生醫光電工程概論
goals:
The students will be able to understand the physics mechanism underlying the
Technologies.
The students will be familiar with the development of the contemporary photonics technologies used for biology, chemistry, and pharmacology study.
syllabus:
【Teaching method: 16+2 weeks】

  

The topic for each week is listed below. 

  

1 Introduction of biophotonics

2 Basics of biology

3 Fundamentals of light-matter interaction

4 Principle of lasers and current laser technologies

5 Principles of optical microscopy

6 Fluorescence microscopy

7 Confocal microscopy & light-sheet microscopy

8 Fluorescence techniques (FRAP, FLIM, FRET…)

9 Super-resolution microscopies

10 Single-molecule imaging

11 Optical clearing for tissue imaging

12 OCT, Photoacoustic tomography, and endoscopy

13 Nanoparticles for imaging

14 Optical biosensors

15 Optical manipulations of biomaterials

16 Exam

17-18  Self-learning

methodologies.note: Concepts and principles of biophotonics technologies will be introduced in the lecture.
Important applications related to the topics will be covered in the class. Students are encouraged to ask questions and discuss the advantages and limitations with each other.
During the semester, the students will choose a topic from recently published research papers and share his/her own opinions from studying this paper.

grading.note: The students will need to write a report based on their study of the research paper for the oral presentation. The report should include three chapters: introduction, discussion, and conclusion. The words count should not be less than 500 words and the report should be written in English.
The final exam will be in an open book fashioned. The range includes all the topics appeared in the lecture.

The students will be asked to present a research paper that is related to the biophotonics technology. The presentation should include a brief introduction to the research and his/her own comment/discoveries through the studying. The length of the presentation should not exceed 10 minutes.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
